title: Germany’s Leader Heads to Beijing Despite Rising Geopolitical Tensions
description:
A.M. Edition for Nov. 3. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is due to travel to meet with Chinese leader Xi Jinping on Friday, becoming the first G-7 leader to visit China since the start of the pandemic. WSJ Germany correspondent Bojan Pancevski explains that the visit will be a key test for Scholz as he attempts to balance responding to China’s diplomatic support for Russia with preserving economic ties as Germany teeters on the brink of a recession. Luke Vargas hosts.
